title: People with ADHD, what is something you would like other people to understand?

body: The way we think is different.  It isn't that we just "get distracted" per se.  It's that we have a consistent stream of thoughts that often progress down a tangent.
body_html: The way we think is different. It isn't that we just "get distracted" per se. It's that we have a consistent stream of thoughts that often progress down a tangent.

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.
author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body: I'm not 100% sure if I have it but I am hyperactive and get easily distracted, and people don't understand just how hard getting things done is for me. I mean they're not much harder, but they take me 10x longer and I'm still given the same expectations as someone who can just breeze through it. When I have a ton of trouble people think I'm just making excuses and being lazy.
body_html: I'm not 100% sure if I have it but I am hyperactive and get easily distracted, and people don't understand just how hard getting things done is for me. I mean they're not much harder, but they take me 10x longer and I'm still given the same expectations as someone who can just breeze through it. When I have a ton of trouble people think I'm just making excuses and being lazy.

post.title: People with ADHD, what is something you would like other people to understand?

body:
I can only speak from my own experience having actually been diagnosed ADHD (and dyslexic to boot).  Can you add color in the tasks that you cannot focus very well on? High school, college, corporate, small business, etc? If you're a gamer, are you able to sit down and play a video game for hours on hours and not get distracted from that? 

From my experience, captivation is a dependency of my ability to stay focused. You may be experiencing a similar concept here.  It would be a sign that you either consciously or subconsciously feel under-utilized in the areas your mind tends to find the tangent.  That's what I have learned from my own experiences (college grad in 4 years at a large prestigious state school and 10+ years in the professional workforce both small business and corporate).
body_html:
I can only speak from my own experience having actually been diagnosed ADHD (and dyslexic to boot). Can you add color in the tasks that you cannot focus very well on? High school, college, corporate, small business, etc? If you're a gamer, are you able to sit down and play a video game for hours on hours and not get distracted from that?

From my experience, captivation is a dependency of my ability to stay focused. You may be experiencing a similar concept here. It would be a sign that you either consciously or subconsciously feel under-utilized in the areas your mind tends to find the tangent. That's what I have learned from my own experiences (college grad in 4 years at a large prestigious state school and 10+ years in the professional workforce both small business and corporate).

body: I'm definitely a lot better off when I'm captivated but I still have trouble actually following through with anything. I tend to get an idea and never be able to finish it. I also suck at everything because I'm a stupid guy with no intellectual or creative talents (it runs in my family), but even the stuff I can do I have trouble actually working on it. This happens across the board and with nothing in particular.
body_html: I'm definitely a lot better off when I'm captivated but I still have trouble actually following through with anything. I tend to get an idea and never be able to finish it. I also suck at everything because I'm a stupid guy with no intellectual or creative talents (it runs in my family), but even the stuff I can do I have trouble actually working on it. This happens across the board and with nothing in particular.

post.title: People with ADHD, what is something you would like other people to understand?

body:
I am diagnosed but I also find myself agreeing with nay-sayers at times. I think it's a psychological condition rooted in emotional development issues and some symptoms are alleviated by drugs. I do think that working through the trauma can eventually fix the condition. Obviously the habits and brain chemistry take time even once you get to the root of the issues, but it can be done. 

Having a kid with ADHD is a tip that their needs aren't being met, it's not like cancer where it just randomly strikes you. 

Another thing - I think a lot of underachieving rich kids get diagnosed to have access to performance enhancing drugs, whether or not they actually have it. I think it is over-diagnosed and over-medicated, but I suppose at the same time I think more kids than ever have major emotional development problems, so perhaps it's only a reflection of that.
body_html:
I am diagnosed but I also find myself agreeing with nay-sayers at times. I think it's a psychological condition rooted in emotional development issues and some symptoms are alleviated by drugs. I do think that working through the trauma can eventually fix the condition. Obviously the habits and brain chemistry take time even once you get to the root of the issues, but it can be done.

Having a kid with ADHD is a tip that their needs aren't being met, it's not like cancer where it just randomly strikes you.

Another thing - I think a lot of underachieving rich kids get diagnosed to have access to performance enhancing drugs, whether or not they actually have it. I think it is over-diagnosed and over-medicated, but I suppose at the same time I think more kids than ever have major emotional development problems, so perhaps it's only a reflection of that.

post.title: People with ADHD, what is something you would like other people to understand?

author.bio: Professional IT, Radio and Electronics technician, 15+ years experience.  III%.  Youngest old fart you'll ever meet.
author.bio_html: Professional IT, Radio and Electronics technician, 15+ years experience. III%. Youngest old fart you'll ever meet.

body: People with adhd tend to have terrible problems with their memory. We aren't space cadets, our brains just don't record information like others do.
body_html: People with adhd tend to have terrible problems with their memory. We aren't space cadets, our brains just don't record information like others do.

post.title: People with ADHD, what is something you would like other people to understand?

body:
I was diagnosed with adhd as a teenager

I didn't like the pills so I sold them to classmates who used them to stay up all night studying or drinking

I never felt having "untreated adhd" held me back in life
body_html:
I was diagnosed with adhd as a teenager

I didn't like the pills so I sold them to classmates who used them to stay up all night studying or drinking

I never felt having "untreated adhd" held me back in life

post.title: People with ADHD, what is something you would like other people to understand?

body: The tangent of a tangent is still a single tangle. And then when you are tangled you try to get out of it but have already forgotten what the original topic was. So untangling becomes difficult.
body_html: The tangent of a tangent is still a single tangle. And then when you are tangled you try to get out of it but have already forgotten what the original topic was. So untangling becomes difficult.
